acceptedAnswer.text: Typically the dry-season window offers more favorable winds for many west-coast reefs, with shoulder seasons balancing crowds and quality. Always check current local forecasts before booking.

mainEntity.name: Where should a beginner book their first overseas surf trip?

acceptedAnswer.text: Zones with forgiving points/beaches and schools nearby: Sri Lanka, Costa Rica, some Canary Islands and Algarve options—ideally during their calmer seasonal windows.

mainEntity.name: How do I escape crowds at world-class zones?

acceptedAnswer.text: Go early, aim for shoulder seasons, and surf B-tier peaks a headland away. A zone with multiple aspects (e.g., Peniche, Almadies) lets you pivot with wind and tide.
